column1: Undescended testicles are fairly common in infants who are born early.
This may be due to a problem that occurred while the baby was still developing before birth.
Most of the time there are no symptoms other than the absence of the testicle in the scrotum.
The provider may or may not be able to feel the undescended testicle in the abdominal wall above the scrotum.
- Surgery (orchiopexy) to bring the testicle into the scrotum.
